images.copyright: Snow buntings flock during a snowstorm in New York (© Marie Read/Minden Pictures)
images.title: A flurry of 'snowflakes'
images.caption: Snow buntings take flight
images.desc: These snowflakes have feathers! The birds you see in this wintry image are snow buntings, sometimes referred to as 'snowflakes' because of the distinct white in their wings. These medium-sized Arctic specialists love the cold and travel farther north than other passerine birds. Only ravens can be found north of snow buntings.

tooltips.walle: This image is not available to download as wallpaper.
